task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 328°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full façade including base and roofline; the current view may not capture the top, so I should tilt up while keeping the building centered.
The prompt specifies the target building is to the northwest (~328°), but I'm currently facing north, so I should rotate left about 32° to align with it.
I need to capture the full vertical extent of the main building (base to roof), so I should tilt up to include the roofline for a height estimate.
I'm again facing north instead of the target northwest (~328°), so I should rotate left about 32° to re-center the building before estimating height.
Rather than oscillating, I should now finish by estimating height from visible stories/roofline; the building appears about 4 stories plus roof, roughly 14–16 m total.
